# The `SCEV` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This class represents an analyzed expression in the program. <a href="#details">More...</a>

<CodeBlock>class llvm::SCEV</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

This class represents an analyzed expression in the program.

These are opaque objects that the client is not allowed to do much with directly.

Definition at line 71 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h">ScalarEvolution.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Enumerations

### enum  {#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="enum llvm::SCEV::NoWrapFlags ">
<a href="#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6f">NoWrapFlags</a> are bitfield indices into SubclassData.

<EnumerationList title="Enumeration values">

<Link id="af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6fa23e74052c4d79cfdaa23460a3c946656" />
<EnumerationListItem name="FlagAnyWrap">
 (= 0)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6faf763167030e97d18e8f8c8ed3dba28e3" />
<EnumerationListItem name="FlagNW">
 (= (1 &lt;&lt; 0))
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6faafb62cd6afdc004ef6e8a1f6288eb382" />
<EnumerationListItem name="FlagNUW">
 (= (1 &lt;&lt; 1))
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6fa2f7a8775a783f7ea3ad24b3f9cb5d949" />
<EnumerationListItem name="FlagNSW">
 (= (1 &lt;&lt; 2))
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6fae022582ed4b56bdb108b4488809e11e6" />
<EnumerationListItem name="NoWrapMask">
 (= (1 &lt;&lt; 3) - 1)
</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

Add and Mul expressions may have no-unsigned-wrap &lt;NUW&gt; or no-signed-wrap &lt;NSW&gt; properties, which are derived from the IR operator. NSW is a misnomer that we use to mean no signed overflow or underflow.

AddRec expressions may have a no-self-wraparound &lt;NW&gt; property if, in the integer domain, abs(step) &#42; max-iteration(loop) &lt;= unsigned-max(bitwidth). This means that the recurrence will never reach its start value if the step is non-zero. Computing the same value on each iteration is not considered wrapping, and recurrences with step = 0 are trivially &lt;NW&gt;. &lt;NW&gt; is independent of the sign of step and the value the add recurrence starts with.

Note that NUW and NSW are also valid properties of a recurrence, and either implies NW. For convenience, NW will be set for a recurrence whenever either NUW or NSW are set.

We require that the flag on a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> apply to the entire scope in which that <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> is defined. A <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a>&#39;s scope is set of locations dominated by a defining location, which is in turn described by the following rules:
<ul>
<li>A <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevunknown">SCEVUnknown</a> is at the point of definition of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a>.</li>
<li>A <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevconstant">SCEVConstant</a> is defined at all points.</li>
<li>A SCEVAddRec is defined starting with the header of the associated loop.</li>
<li>All other SCEVs are defined at the earlest point all operands are defined.</li>
</ul>


The above rules describe a maximally hoisted form (without regards to potential control dependence). A <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> is defined anywhere a corresponding instruction could be defined in said maximally hoisted form. Note that <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevudivexpr">SCEVUDivExpr</a> (currently the only expression type which can trap) can be defined per these rules in regions where it would trap at runtime. A <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> being defined does not require the existence of any instruction within the defined scope.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h/#l00126">126</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h">ScalarEvolution.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

### print() {#acdbe9e14ed6edbd5b5e3c252585902ec}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void SCEV::print (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp; OS) const</>}>
Print out the internal representation of this scalar to the specified stream.

This should really only be used for debugging purposes.
